name: Shop Robbery Simulator
description:
Shop Robbery Simulator is a teeny-tiny text adventure that I programmed in plain #C during my studies. It has a playtime of ~5 minutes.

Goal of the project was to successfully make use of different data structures such as:

  • linear data structure (inventory handling)
  • graph data structure (rooms and doors)
  • tree data structure (dialog) 
  • sortable data structure (highscore) 

In the game, you will take on the role of a clever criminal who is about to rob a store. Grab the most valuable items to get the highest score. Can you make it in and out of the store before the police arrive?

Feel free to share your highscore in a comment below!
